definition: to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: This is my first time to eat teppanyaki.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次吃铁板烧。

sentences.english: Why don't we go for Teppanyaki tonight?
sentences.chinese: 我们晚上去吃铁板烧怎么样？

sentences.english: Baked chicken one night can become fajitas the next night.
sentences.chinese: 过夜的烤鸡可以加工成次夜的墨西哥铁板烧。

sentences.english: We went to a teppanyaki restaurant where they cook in front of you.
sentences.chinese: 我们去了一家有专人为你现场烘烤的铁板烧餐厅。

sentences.english: Selection of tiger prawn, fish, squid, lobster and soft shell crab, pan seared with Kerala marinade.
sentences.chinese: 喀拉拉铁板烧虎虾，鱼，乌贼，龙虾或软蟹。

sentences.english: For you choose teppanyaki equipment manufacturer headache?
sentences.chinese: 您还在为选择铁板烧设备厂家头痛不已么？

sentences.english: Simon: Why don’t we go for Teppanyaki tonight?
sentences.chinese: 我们晚上去吃铁板烧怎么样？

sentences.english: Next come another popular Korean dish called galbi.
sentences.chinese: 下一道菜，是韩国最流行的叫“铁板烧。

definition: Japanese cuisine (abbr. for 日本料理[Ri4 ben3 liao4 li3])
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
tempura/deep-fried cooking/also called 甜不辣[tian2 bu4 la4]
